Redistribution and use in source and binary forms are permitted provided that the above copyright notice and this paragraph are duplicated in all such forms and that any documentation, advertising materials, and other materials related to such distribution and use acknowledge that the software was developed by <<var;name="acknowledgedDeveloperNames";original="the University of California, Berkeley.";match="[^.]+\.">> The name of <<var;name="noEndorseNames";original="the University";match="[^.]+">> may not be used to endorse or promote products derived from this software without specific prior written permission. contents.contents: A license is allowed if Fedora determines that the license is a free software / open source license. At a high level, the inquiry involves determining whether the license provides software freedom, and (equivalently) making sure that the license does not place burdens on users' exercise of its permissions that are inconsistent with evolving community norms and traditions around what is acceptable in a free software / open source license. See below for more on the history of Fedora licensing policy.
Open source license that is made available under "non-copyleft" licenses. These generally require attribution of the included works and may include other obligations.
Whether the license includes a notice obligation or similar which can be fulfilled by adding the relevant copyright notices and the license text into the project/product notice file.
Same as above, as a temporary work-around for the category name not being configurable in ORT reports, see https://github.com/oss-review-toolkit/ort/issues/8220.

Licenses with this property prohibit the making of modifications to the licensed content. This is initially applied to Creative Commons licenses but will be used more widely as license reviews progress. Contributions/pull requests are welcome.
This license requires a notice in certain advertisements for the product (typically those mentioning features of the licensed software) that the licensed software is being used.

_olcCategories.description: Open source license that is made available under "non-copyleft" licenses. These generally require attribution of the included works and may include other obligations.
_olcCategories.name: permissive

_olcCategories.description: Whether the license includes a notice obligation or similar which can be fulfilled by adding the relevant copyright notices and the license text into the project/product notice file.
_olcCategories.name: property:include-in-notice-file

_olcCategories.description: Same as above, as a temporary work-around for the category name not being configurable in ORT reports, see https://github.com/oss-review-toolkit/ort/issues/8220.
_olcCategories.name: include-in-notice-file

_olcCategories.description: Licenses with this property prohibit the making of modifications to the licensed content. This is initially applied to Creative Commons licenses but will be used more widely as license reviews progress. Contributions/pull requests are welcome.
_olcCategories.name: property:no-modifications

_olcCategories.description: This license requires a notice in certain advertisements for the product (typically those mentioning features of the licensed software) that the licensed software is being used.
_olcCategories.name: property:advertising-clause

contents.contents: Eine Lizenz ist freigegeben, wenn sie nach fachlicher und juristischer Prüfung seitens Open CoDE sowohl der Open Source Definition (gemäß Definition der Open Source Initiative [extern]) entspricht und darüber hinaus keine für die Öffentliche Verwaltung erkennbaren Schwierigkeiten birgt. Außer in Ausnahmefällen ist nicht zu erwarten, dass einmal freigegebene Lizenzen deklassifiziert werden.
